title: Creating an Inequality
text: We must first write an inequality to represent the number of people Daniel can have at his party (n) in terms of the amount of money he has ($500).

title: Creating an Inequality
text: Since we know that the cost for dinner is $42.75 per person, 42.75*(the number of people) must be less than or equal to $500, which is the budget. This can be represented by the inequality $$42.75n \leq 500$$

title: Solving the Inequality
text: We must now isolate the variable n so that we can calculate the maximum number of people Daniel can have at the party.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To isolate the variable, we must divide both sides of the inequality by 42.75. We now have $$n \leq 11.695$$.

title: Creating a Sentence-Answer
text: Since we know that n, the number of people Daniel can have at his party, must be less than or equal to 11.695, what is the maximum (whole) number of people Daniel can have at the party?
